name: saxifrage
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a plant with small leaves and small white, pink, purple, or yellow flowers that grows close to the ground, especially in mountain areas: He could see the whites and pinks of saxifrage among the scree and rock beneath the cliffs. Short-leaved gentian and moss-like saxifrage bordered the narrow path.
More examplesFewer examplesWe camped for the night in a field studded with saxifrages and other flowers. A mixture of loam and well-rotted compost with lots of grit added will suit most of the saxifrage family. Even when they are not flowering, saxifrages are neat plants, often forming geometric rosettes of leaves.
